title.narrative: Preservation of Threatened San Rock Art at Matobo Hills World Heritage Site

description.narrative: The Matobo Hills World Heritage site encompasses hundreds of rock art sites, many of which have yet to be identified or documented. This project, which focuses on rock art within the communal lands of Ward 17 and Matobo National Park, involves the identification and preservation of rock art susceptible to environmental and other damage.

title.narrative: Preservation of 16th-Century Enclosure Walls at Naletale National Monument

description.narrative: Patterns on the dry stone walls associated with the Shona culture speak to the high level of craftsmanship and creativity of this civilization, yet the walls have steadily deteriorated and cannot be salvaged if they collapse. The project involves training in the restoration of these stone walls, the reversal of earlier unsuccessful attempts at repair, and thorough documentation.
